title: How to Straighten Used Wool

steps.headline: Unravel the used wool from wherever you are obtaining it.
Wind it around the stiff piece of cardboard.
Secure the wool with a staple, tape, or similar item, to the cardboard.
Immerse the entire cardboard and wound wool into hot, soapy water.
Rinse.
steps.description: Hang out to dry on the clothesline.

steps.headline: Remove the dry wool.
steps.description: Once dried, the wool can be unwound and you will find that it is ready for re-winding and use.

text: Unravel the used wool from wherever you are obtaining it.  Wind it around the stiff piece of cardboard.  Secure the wool with a staple, tape, or similar item, to the cardboard.  Immerse the entire cardboard and wound wool into hot, soapy water.  Wash the wool thoroughly.  Rinse. Hang out to dry on the clothesline. Remove the dry wool. Once dried, the wool can be unwound and you will find that it is ready for re-winding and use.
